definition: band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Therefore, in order to ease the pressure, Ai Fujinuma brought to the comic.
sentences.chinese: 因此，为了缓解压力，福原爱带上了漫画。

sentences.english: I think I'll get a banjo.
But we both took one true heart and two box of loquats.
sentences.chinese: 但我们还是带上一颗真心，两箱枇杷。

sentences.english: Please pull the door to when you go out.
KERSH puts his glasses back on and returns to his papers.
sentences.chinese: 克什把眼镜又带上继续处理它的文档。

sentences.english: Let the traffic policemen wear black cotton gloves.
Load up on guns and, Bring your friends.
sentences.chinese: 把枪装上子弹，带上你的朋友。

sentences.english: One should bring a flashlight when walking in mountains at night.
sentences.chinese: 夜里走山路，应该带上电棒儿。

sentences.english: They flew higher and higher into the air. The grandmother took the little girl to paradise.
sentences.chinese: 她们在空中越飞越高，奶奶把小女孩带上了天堂。

sentences.english: Grab your shades and your sunblock.
sentences.chinese: 带上你的墨镜和防晒霜。

sentences.english: I put on my safety helmet and the glove, and sat on my silver-white colored bike.
sentences.chinese: 我带上安全帽和手套，帅气的跨上我的银白色铁马。

sentences.english: It's showery today. Take an umbrella with you.
sentences.chinese: 今天有阵雨，带上雨伞吧。

sentences.english: Although the sun was shining the other day, my father took the umbrella with him to be on the safe side.
sentences.chinese: 虽然那天阳光明媚，我父亲还是带上了雨伞以防不测。

sentences.english: Bring several of them. Trash compactor bags are the sturdiest .
sentences.chinese: 带上几个垃圾袋吧，它们是最结实的。

sentences.english: Who's the guy with the Albert chain?
sentences.chinese: 那个胸口带上挂个表链的家伙是谁？

sentences.english: He took sleds and dogs with him.
sentences.chinese: 然后带上几只雪橇犬，便拉着他出发了。

definition: band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
to (carry) on one's person/to (take) with one
to go out/to go away (on a trip etc)
to take out/to put out/to provide/to put forward (a proposal)/to come up with (evidence)
preparation/to prepare/to intend/to be about to/reserve (fund)
to send to/to deliver to/to give sb a lift (e.g. in a car)
